alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 5:25AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wyoming, including the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated and are likely to overflow banks causing flooding in some areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 AM MDT, rain is falling in the region. Rainfall will continue through late morning, before tapering off this afternoon. Another 0.25 inches to 0.50 inches of rain may occur. With already saturated ground conditions, runoff from additional rainfall will add to the flood potential. There are no river gauges in the Advisory area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not attempt to cross flooded areas. Campers and hikers should avoid setting up camp near streams or creeks.
